tit.e: Kami-umi (a myth about giving birth to gods)
Kami-umi (a myth about giving birth to gods)

sen.j: 日本神話にて、神産み（かみうみ）とは、イザナギ・イザナミが島々を生んだ（国産みの）後、神々を生み出していったことを指す。
sen.e: In Japanese myths, kami-umi refers to Izanagi and Izanami's giving birth to numerous deities after they gave birth to various islands (kuni-umi (the birth of (the land) of Japan).
In Japanese myths, Kami-umi refers to Izanagi and Izanami's giving birth to numerous gods after they gave birth to various islands (Kuni-umi [a myth about the birth of the land of Japan]).
In Japanese myths, Kami-umi refers to Izanagi and Izanami's giving birth to numerous gods after they gave birth to various islands (Kuni-umi [a myth about the birth of the land of Japan]).

sen.j: イザナギ・イザナミは、様々な神々を生み出していったが、火の神カグツチを出産した際に、イザナミは火傷で死ぬ。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami produced numerous deities, but when Izanami gave birth to the fire-deity Kagutsuchi, she died from the burns.
Izanagi and Izanami produced numerous gods, but when Izanami gave birth to the fire god Kagutsuchi, she died from the burns.
Izanagi and Izanami produced numerous gods, but when Izanami gave birth to the fire god Kagutsuchi, she died from the burns.

sen.j: 愛する妻を失ったイザナギはその怒りから、迦具土（加具土）神を十拳剣で切り殺した。
sen.e: Having lost his beloved wife and full of rage, Izanagi slew Kagutsuchi-no-kami (written in 迦具土 or 加具土 in Chinese character) with Totsuka no Tsurugi (Literally, "the ten-hands-long sword").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 ()内が一文のため、二つに分けました。原文、複数箇所で「迦具土（加具土）神」と漢字を説明してありますが、訳文では重複を避けるため、この文以降はローマ字による読み方のみを示しています。
sen.e: Having lost his beloved wife and full of rage, Izanagi slew Kagutsuchi no kami (written in 迦具土 or 加具土 in Chinese characters) with Totsuka no Tsurugi (literally, "the ten-hands-long sword").
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにしました。
sen.e: Having lost his beloved wife and full of rage, Izanagi slew Kagutsuchi no kami (written in 迦具土 or 加具土 in Chinese characters) with Totsuka no Tsurugi (literally, "the ten-hands-long sword").

sen.j: （この剣に付着し、したたり落ちた血からまた神々が生まれる。）
sen.e: (Other deities came into being from the blood on the sword as it dripped off.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 ()内が一文のため、二つに分けました。
sen.e: (Other gods came into being from the blood on the sword as it dripped off.)
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにしました。
sen.e: (Other gods came into being from the blood on the sword as it dripped off.)

sen.j: イザナギはイザナミをさがしに黄泉の国へと赴くが、黄泉の国のイザナミは既に変わり果てた姿になっていた。
sen.e: Izanagi went down to Yomi, the land of the dead, to look for Izanami, but found that she had already been completely changed from her former self.
Izanagi went down to Yomi (the land of the dead) to look for Izanami, but found that she had already been completely changed from her former self.
Izanagi went down to Yomi (the land of the dead) to look for Izanami, but found that she had already been completely changed from her former self.

sen.j: これにおののいたイザナギは逃げた。
sen.e: Shuddering at this, Izanagi fled.
Shuddering at this, Izanagi fled.
Shuddering at this, Izanagi fled.

sen.j: イザナギは、黄泉のケガレを清めるために、禊ぎをした。
sen.e: Izanagi performed a purification ceremony to cleanse himself of the pollution he had taken on in Yomi (the land of the dead).
Izanagi performed a purification ceremony to cleanse himself of the pollution he had taken on in the Yomi.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Izanagi performed a purification ceremony to cleanse himself of the pollution he had taken on in the Yomi.

sen.j: この時も、様々な神々が生まれた。
sen.e: Various deities also came into being on this occasion.
Various gods also came into being on this occasion.
Various gods also came into being on this occasion.

sen.j: 最後に生まれたアマテラス（日の神、高天原を支配）・ツクヨミ（月の神、夜を支配）・スサノオ（海を支配）は三貴神と呼ばれた。
sen.e: Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess, ruling Takamanohara (the plain of high heaven)), Tsukuyomi (the deity of the Moon, ruling over the night) and Susano (ruling the sea) were born last and were called the three noble deities.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess, ruling Takamanohara [the plain of high heaven]), Tsukuyomi (the deity of the Moon, ruling over the night) and Susano (ruling the sea) were born last and were called the three noble gods.
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにし、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Amaterasu (the Sun Goddess, ruling Takamanohara [the plain of high heaven]), Tsukuyomi (the deity of the Moon, ruling over the night) and Susano (ruling the sea) were born last and were called the three noble gods.

sen.j: 彼らはイザナギによって世界の支配を命じられた。
sen.e: They were charged by Izanagi with ruling the world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were ordered by Izanagi to rule the world.
They were ordered by Izanagi to rule the world.

tit.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 大八洲国およびその他の小さな島々を産み終えたイザナギ・イザナミは、神々を産んだ。
sen.e: After they finished bearing the Oyashima-guni (Eight Great Islands) and other small islands, Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to deities.
After they finished bearing the Oyashima no kuni (Eight Great Islands) and other small islands, Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to gods.
After they finished bearing the Oyashima no kuni (Eight Great Islands) and other small islands, Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to gods.

sen.j: ここで産まれる神は、家宅六神および風の神・木の神・野の神といったような自然にまつわる神々である。
sen.e: The deities that came into being here were the six deities that protected the household and deities related to nature such as the deity of wind, the deity of trees and the deity of fields.
The gods that came into being here were related with nature, such as the six gods to protect the household, the god of wind, the god of trees, and the god of fields.
The gods that came into being here were related with nature, such as the six gods to protect the household, the god of wind, the god of trees, and the god of fields.

sen.j: ところが、火の神である迦具土神を出産したために、イザナミの女陰が焼けてしまい、イザナミは病気になった。
sen.e: However, Izanami became ill because her genitals were burned when she gave birth to a fire deity, Kagutsuchi-no-kami.
However, Izanami became ill because her genitals were burned when she gave birth to a fire god, Kagutsuchi no kami.
However, Izanami became ill because her genitals were burned when she gave birth to a fire god, Kagutsuchi no kami.

sen.j: イザナミは、病に苦しみながらも、吐瀉物などから次々と神を生んでいった。
sen.e: Although Izanami was still suffering from her illness, she continued to produce deities one after another from her vomit and excrement and other things.
Although Izanami was still suffering from her illness, she continued to produce gods one after another from her vomit and others.
Although Izanami was still suffering from her illness, she continued to produce gods one after another from her vomit and others.

sen.j: イザナギは、イザナミの死に涕泣した。
sen.e: Izanagi wept at the death of Izanami.
Izanagi wept at the death of Izanami.
Izanagi wept at the death of Izanami.

sen.j: この涙から、神がまた生まれた。
sen.e: Other deities were born from these tears.
Other gods were born from these tears.
Other gods were born from these tears.

sen.j: そして、イザナギは、イザナミを出雲国と伯伎(伯耆)国の堺にある比婆山(現；島根県安来市)に葬った。
sen.e: Then, Izanagi buried Izanami on Mt. Hibanoyama, located at the boundary between Izumo Province and Hoki Province (the present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture).
Then, Izanagi buried Izanami on Mt. Hibanoyama, located at the boundary between Izumo Province and Hoki Province (the present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture).
Then, Izanagi buried Izanami on Mt. Hibanoyama, located at the boundary between Izumo Province and Hoki Province (the present-day Yasugi City, Shimane Prefecture).

sen.j: 愛する妻を失ったイザナギはその怒りから、迦具土（加具土）神を十束剣で切り殺した。
sen.e: Out of fury at losing his beloved wife, Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi-no-kami with Totsuka no Tsurugi.
Out of fury at losing his beloved wife, Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi no kami with a Totsuka no Tsurugi sword.
Out of fury at losing his beloved wife, Izanagi killed Kagutsuchi no kami with a Totsuka no Tsurugi sword.

sen.j: この剣に付着した血からまた神々が生まれる。
sen.e: There other deities came into being from the blood on the sword.
There other gods came into being from the blood on the sword again.
There other gods came into being from the blood on the sword again.

sen.j: なお、この十拳剣の名前を「天之尾羽張」（あめのをはばり）、別名を伊都之尾羽張（いつのをはばり）という。
sen.e: This Totsuka no Tsurugi also has the name, 'Ame no o habari' (天之尾羽張), and it is also called Itsu no o habari (伊都之尾羽張).
This Totsuka no Tsurugi sword was called 'Ame no o habari' (天之尾羽張), or Itsu no o habari (伊都之尾羽張).
This Totsuka no Tsurugi sword was called 'Ame no o habari' (天之尾羽張), or Itsu no o habari (伊都之尾羽張).

sen.j: また、殺された迦具土神の体からも、神々が生まれた。
sen.e: In addition, some deities also came into being from the body of Kagutsuchi-no-kami, who had been killed.
In addition, some gods also came into being from the body of lost Kagutsuchi no kami.
In addition, some gods also came into being from the body of lost Kagutsuchi no kami.

tit.e: Yomi, The Land of The Dead

sen.j: イザナギは、イザナミを取り戻そうとして、黄泉国へと赴いた。
sen.e: Izanagi went down to Yomi, the land of the dead, to get Izanami back.
Izanagi went down to Yominokuni to get Izanami back.
Izanagi went down to Yominokuni to get Izanami back.

sen.j: 黄泉に着いたイザナギは戸越しに、イザナミに言った。
sen.e: Arriving in the land of the dead, Izanagi called to Izanami from the other side of a door:
Arriving in Yomi, Izanagi called to Izanami from the other side of a door:
Arriving in Yomi, Izanagi called to Izanami from the other side of a door:

sen.j: 「あなたと一緒に創った国土はまだ完成していません。帰りましょう」
sen.e: 'You know, the lands we were creating together haven't been completed, so let's go back.'
sen.cmt: 担当者様と相談の上、「」内の台詞は一文とみなしました。
sen.e: You know, the lands we were creating together haven't been completed, so let's go back.'
sen.cmt: ウェブから「帰りましょう」を補足しました。
sen.e: You know, the lands we were creating together haven't been completed, so let's go back.'

sen.j: イザナミは「黄泉の国の食べ物を食べてしまったので、生き返ることはできません」と答えた。
sen.e: Izanami answered: 'I cannot come back to life because I have already eaten food from land of the dead.'
Izanami answered: 'I cannot come back to life because I have already eaten food of the Yominokuni.'
Izanami answered: 'I cannot come back to life because I have already eaten food of the Yominokuni.'

sen.j: （注：黄泉の国のものを食べると、黄泉の住人になると考えられていた。)
sen.e: (Note: it was thought that if people ate anything from Yomi, they would become inhabitants of Yomi.
(Note: It was thought that if people ate anything from Yominokuni, they would become inhabitants of the Yomi.)
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにしました。
sen.e: (Note: It was thought that if people ate anything from Yominokuni, they would become inhabitants of the Yomi.)

sen.j: (これを「よもつへぐい」と言う。）
sen.e: This is called 'Yomotsue-gui'.)
(This is called 'Yomotsu-hegui.')
(This is called 'Yomotsu-hegui.')

sen.j: さらにイザナミは「黄泉神と相談しましょう。お願いですから、私の姿は見ないで下さいね」と言い、家の奥に入っていった。
sen.e: In addition, Izanami said, 'I'll discuss it with the deity of Yomi, but I beg you, please don't look at me,' then went back into the hall.
sen.cmt: 担当者様と相談の上、「」内の台詞は一文とみなしました。
sen.e: In addition, Izanami said, 'I'll discuss it with the god of Yomi, but I beg you, please don't look at me,' then went back into the building.
In addition, Izanami said, 'I'll discuss it with the god of Yomi, but I beg you, please don't look at me,' then went back into the building.

sen.j: イザナギは、なかなか戻ってこないイザナミに痺れを切らした。
sen.e: After quite a long time Izanami still had not returned, and Izanagi could not wait anymore.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After quite a long time Izanami still had not returned, Izanagi could not wait anymore.
After quite a long time Izanami still had not returned, Izanagi could not wait anymore.

sen.j: そして、自分の左の角髪（みずら）につけていた湯津津間櫛（ゆつつなくし）という櫛の端の歯を折って、火をともして、中を覗き込んだ。
sen.e: He broke the teeth off a comb called Yutsutsunakushi (湯津津間櫛), which he was wearing in his left hair-bunch (mizura, a male hairstyle), lit a fire with them, and looked into the hall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He broke the teeth off a comb called Yutsutsuna-kushi, which he was wearing in his left hair-bunch (mizura, a male hairstyle), lit a fire with them, and looked into the building.
He broke the teeth off a comb called Yutsutsuna-kushi, which he was wearing in his left hair-bunch (mizura, a male hairstyle), lit a fire with them, and looked into the building.

sen.j: すると、イザナミは、すでに美しきイザナミではなかった。
sen.e: Izanami did not look like his beautiful Izanami any more.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Izanami did not look like beautiful Izanami any more.
Izanami did not look like beautiful Izanami any more.

sen.j: 体は腐って蛆がたかり、声はむせびふさがっており、体には8柱の雷神（八雷神）がまとわりついていた。
sen.e: Her body was rotted and full of maggots, her voice strangled and choked, and on top of that, eight thunder-deities were clinging to her body.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Her body was rotted and full of maggots, her voice strangled and choked, and on top of that, eight thunder gods were clinging to her body.
Her body was rotted and full of maggots, her voice strangled and choked, and on top of that, eight thunder gods were clinging to her body.

sen.j: これにおののいたイザナギは逃げ帰ろうとした。
sen.e: Shuddering with fear at the sight of her, Izanagi tried to run back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shuddering with fear at the sight of her, Izanagi tried to run back.
Shuddering with fear at the sight of her, Izanagi tried to run back.

sen.j: が、イザナミは自分の醜い姿を見られたことを恥じて、黄泉醜女（よもつしこめ）に命じて、イザナギを追わせた。
sen.e: However, Izanami felt shame at her repulsive appearance being seen, and commanded Yomotsu-shikome (a hag from Yomi (the land of the dead)) and had her chase Izanagi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Izanami felt shame at her repulsive appearance being seen, and commanded Yomotsu-shikome (a hag from Yomi) and had her chase Izanagi.
sen.cmt: 半角カッコにしました。
sen.e: However, Izanami felt shame at her repulsive appearance being seen, and commanded Yomotsu-shikome (a hag from Yomi) and had her chase Izanagi.

sen.j: イザナギは、つる植物（つるくさ）を輪にして頭の上に載せていたものを投げ捨てた。
sen.e: Izanagi threw away the vine that he had made a loop with and was wearing on his head.
Izanagi threw away the vine loop that was wearing on his head.
Izanagi threw away the vine loop that was wearing on his head.

sen.j: すると、ブドウの実がなり、黄泉醜女がそれを食べている間、逃げた。
sen.e: Bunches of grapes grew on it, and he ran away while the hag of Yomi was eating them.
Then bunches of grapes grew on it to make him run away while Yomotsu-shikome was eating them.
Then bunches of grapes grew on it to make him run away while Yomotsu-shikome was eating them.

sen.j: しかし、まだ追いかけてくるので、右の角髪（みずら）につけていた湯津津間櫛（ゆつつなくし）という竹の櫛を投げた。
sen.e: However, she continued to run after him, and he threw the bamboo comb called Yutsutsunakushi, which he was wearing in his right hair-bunch.
However, she still chased him; he threw the bamboo comb called Yutsutsuna-kushi, which he was wearing in his right hair-bunch.
However, she still chased him; he threw the bamboo comb called Yutsutsuna-kushi, which he was wearing in his right hair-bunch.

sen.j: すると、たちまちタケノコが生え、黄泉醜女がそれを食べている間、逃げた。
sen.e: Bamboo shoots sprouted up in an instant, and he fled while the hag of Yomi was eating them.
Then bamboo shoots sprouted up in an instant to make him run away while Yomotsu-shikome was eating them.
Then bamboo shoots sprouted up in an instant to make him run away while Yomotsu-shikome was eating them.

sen.j: だが、またさらに、イザナミは先ほどの8柱の雷神と黄泉の国の兵士達（黄泉軍）にイザナギを追わせた。
sen.e: However, in addition to these, Izanami made the aforementioned eight thunder-deities and a horde of the soldiers of Yomi (the army of the land of the dead) chase after Izanagi.
In addition, however, Izanami had the aforementioned eight thunder gods and a horde of the soldiers of Yominokuni (the army of the land of the dead) chase after Izanagi.
In addition, however, Izanami had the aforementioned eight thunder gods and a horde of the soldiers of Yominokuni (the army of the land of the dead) chase after Izanagi.

sen.j: イザナギは、十拳剣で振り払いながら逃げたが、それでも追ってきた。
sen.e: Even though Izanagi ran away, keeping them back with Totsuka no Tsurugi, they still kept following him.
Even though Izanagi ran away, keeping them back with a Totsuka no Tsurugi sword, they still kept following him.
Even though Izanagi ran away, keeping them back with a Totsuka no Tsurugi sword, they still kept following him.

sen.j: ようやく黄泉の国と地上の境である黄泉比良坂（よもつひらさか）の坂本に着いた時、坂本にあったモモの実を3つ投げた。
sen.e: When he reached the foot of Yomotsu Hirasaka (the slope that leads to the land of the dead), where was the boundary between the land of the dead and this world, he picked three peaches that were there and threw them at the pursuers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When he reached the foot of Yomotsu Hirasaka (the slope that leads to the land of the dead), where was the boundary between the Yominokuni and this world, he picked three peaches there to throw them at the pursuers.

When he reached the foot of Yomotsu Hirasaka (the slope that leads to the land of the dead), where was the boundary between the Yominokuni and this world, he picked three peaches there to throw them at the pursuers.

sen.j: そのところ、追ってきた黄泉の国の悪霊たちは逃げ帰っていった。
sen.e: Then, the pursuers, the spirits of Yomi, fled back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, the pursuers, the spirits of the Yominokuni, fled back.
Then, the pursuers, the spirits of the Yominokuni, fled back.

sen.j: ここで、イザナギは、桃に「人々が困っている時に助けてくれ」と言って、意富加牟豆美命（おほかむずみのみこと）と名づけた。
sen.e: Here, Izanagi told the peaches to save people as well when they were in trouble, and named them Oho Kamuzumi no Mikoto (意富加牟豆美命).
Here, Izanagi said the peaches 'please help people as well when they are in trouble,' and named them Okamuzumi no mikoto.
Here, Izanagi said the peaches 'please help people as well when they are in trouble,' and named them Okamuzumi no mikoto.

sen.j: 最後に、イザナミ本人が追いかけてきた。
sen.e: In the end, Izanami herself pursued him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the end, Izanami herself pursued him.
In the end, Izanami herself pursued him.

sen.j: それで、イザナギは、千人がかりでなければと動かないような大岩で黄泉比良坂をふさぎ、悪霊が出ないようにした。
sen.e: Izanagi closed off Yomotsu Hirasaka using such a huge boulder that would take a thousand people to move it, so that no evil spirits could come out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Izanagi closed off the Yomotsu Hirasaka using such a huge boulder that would take a thousand people to move it, so that no evil spirits could come out.
Izanagi closed off the Yomotsu Hirasaka using such a huge boulder that would take a thousand people to move it, so that no evil spirits could come out.

sen.j: その岩をはさんで対面して、この夫婦は別れることとなる。
sen.e: Facing each other, being on either side of the boulder, the husband and wife became separated.
Facing each other, being on either side of the boulder, this couple would separate.
Facing each other, being on either side of the boulder, this couple would separate.

sen.j: この時、イザナミは「私はこれから毎日、一日に千人ずつ殺そう」と言った。
sen.e: At this time, Izanami swore, 'I shall kill 1000 people a day from now on.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At this time, Izanami said, 'I will kill 1000 people a day from now on.'
At this time, Izanami said, 'I will kill 1000 people a day from now on.'

sen.j: これに対しイザナギは「それなら私は人間が決して滅びないよう、一日に千五百人生ませよう」と言った。
sen.e: In response, Izanagi announced, 'Then I shall cause one thousand and five hundred people to be born each day, so that they will never die out.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In response, Izanagi said, 'Then I will have 1500 babies born each day, so that they will never die out.'
In response, Izanagi said, 'Then I will have 1500 babies born each day, so that they will never die out.'

sen.j: これは、人間の生死の由来を表している。
sen.e: This shows the original reason why people are born and die.
This shows the original reason why people are born and die.
This shows the original reason why people are born and die.

sen.j: なお、この事件から、イザナミのことを黄泉津大神（よもつおほかみ）・道敷大神（ちしきのおほかみ）とも呼び、黄泉比良坂を塞いだ大岩を道返之大神（ちかへしのおほかみ）・黄泉戸大神（よみとのおほかみ）とも言う。
sen.e: In addition, because of this event, Izanami is also called Yomotsu Okami (黄泉津大神)and Chishiki no Okami (道敷大神), and the boulder that was used to close off Yomotsu Hirasaka is called Chikaeshi no Okami (道返之大神)and Yomito no Okami (黄泉戸大神).

In addition, because of this event, Izanami is also called Yomotsu Okami (the great god of the Yominokuni) or Chishiki no Okami (the god who caught up [with Izanagi]), and the boulder that was used to close the Yomotsu Hirasaka off is called Chikaeshi no Okami (the god to the way back to the Yominokuni) or Yomito no Okami (the god of the door to the Yominokuni).

In addition, because of this event, Izanami is also called Yomotsu Okami (the great god of the Yominokuni) or Chishiki no Okami (the god who caught up [with Izanagi]), and the boulder that was used to close the Yomotsu Hirasaka off is called Chikaeshi no Okami (the god to the way back to the Yominokuni) or Yomito no Okami (the god of the door to the Yominokuni).

sen.j: なお、古事記では、黄泉比良坂は出雲国の伊賦夜坂（いふやのさか；現島根県東出雲町）としている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) has Yomotsu Hirasaka at the Ifuya-no-saka pass in Izumo Province (written 伊賦夜坂 in Chinese characters, the present-day Higashi Izumo Town, Shimane Prefecture).
Furthermore, the Kojiki has Yomotsu Hirasaka at the Ifuya no saka pass in Izumo Province (the present-day Higashi Izumo Town, Shimane Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 前出補足などを削除しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kojiki has Yomotsu Hirasaka at the Ifuya no saka pass in Izumo Province (the present-day Higashi Izumo Town, Shimane Prefecture).

tit.e: Purification Ceremony and the Birth of the Three Noble Children
Purification Ceremony and the Birth of Mihashira no uzuno miko (three noble children)
Purification Ceremony and the Birth of Mihashira no uzuno miko (three noble children)

sen.j: イザナギは、黄泉の穢れから身を清めるために、竺紫（つくし）の日向（ひむか）の橘の小門（をど）の阿波岐原（あはきはら）へ行って、禊を行った。
sen.e: Izanagi went to Awaaki-hara by the river-mouth of Tachibana in Himuka in Tsukushi to purify himself and exorcized the pollution that he had taken on in the land of the dead, performing a purification ceremony.
Izanagi went to Awaaki-hara by the river-mouth of Tachibana of Himuka in Tsukushi and performed a purification ceremony to purify himself from the Yominokuni's impurity.
Izanagi went to Awaaki-hara by the river-mouth of Tachibana of Himuka in Tsukushi and performed a purification ceremony to purify himself from the Yominokuni's impurity.

sen.j: 身に着けていた物を脱ぐことによって十二神が生まれた。
sen.e: Twelve deities came into being as he took off what he had been wearing.
12 gods came into being as he took off what he had been wearing.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字にしました。
sen.e: 12 gods came into being as he took off what he had been wearing.

sen.j: 「上流は流れが速い、下流は流れが弱い」と言って、最初に中流に潜って身を清めた時に二神が生まれた。
sen.e: He said, 'The current of the upper stream flows too swift; the current of the lower stream flows too weak', and two deities came into being when he first dove into the middle course of the water and cleansed his body.
When he first dove into the middle stream to purify his body, saying, 'The upper stream flows too swift and down stream too weak,' two gods came into being.
When he first dove into the middle stream to purify his body, saying, 'The upper stream flows too swift and down stream too weak,' two gods came into being.

sen.j: この二神は黄泉の穢れから生まれた神である。
sen.e: These two deities came into being from the pollution that he had taken on during his stay in the land of the dead.
These two gods was born from the impurity of the Yominokuni.
These two gods was born from the impurity of the Yominokuni.

sen.j: 次に、その禍（まが）を直そうとすると三神が生まれた。
sen.e: Next, he tried to heal the evil, and another three deities came into being.
Next, he tried to heal the evil, and another three gods were born.
Next, he tried to heal the evil, and another three gods were born.

sen.j: 水の底で身を清めると二神が生まれた。
sen.e: Then he purified himself at the bottom of the water, and another two deities came into being.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself at the bottom of the water.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself at the bottom of the water.

sen.j: 水の中程で身を清めると二神が生まれた。
sen.e: Then he purified himself in the middle of the water, and another two deities came into being.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself in the middle of the water.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself in the middle of the water.

sen.j: 水の表面で身を清めると二神が生まれた。
sen.e: Then, he purified himself on the surface of the water, and another two deities came into being.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself on the surface of the water.
Another two gods were born by his purifying himself on the surface of the water.

sen.j: 底津綿津見神・中津綿津見神・上津綿津見神は阿曇連らが信仰している神で、阿曇連らは、これら三神の子の、宇都志日金析命（うつしひかなさくのみこと）の子孫である。
sen.e: Sokotsu Watatsumi no Kami (底津綿津見神), Nakatsu Watatsumi no Kami (中津綿津見神) and Uwatsu Watatsumi no Kami (上津綿津見神) are the deities that people such as the Azumi clan believed in, and the Azumi clan were the descendants of Utsushi Hikana Saku no Mikoto (宇都志日金析命), the son of these three deities.

Sokotsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the bottom part), Nakatsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the middle part) and Uwatsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the upper part) are the gods that people such as the Azumi no Muraji (title given to bureaucrats charged with the imperial table in the seventh century, which was hereditary and reserved for the Azuchi family) believed in who were the descendants of Utsushi Hikana Saku no Mikoto, the son of these three gods.

Sokotsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the bottom part), Nakatsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the middle part) and Uwatsu Watatsumi no Kami (the sea god of the upper part) are the gods that people such as the Azumi no Muraji (title given to bureaucrats charged with the imperial table in the seventh century, which was hereditary and reserved for the Azuchi family) believed in who were the descendants of Utsushi Hikana Saku no Mikoto, the son of these three gods.

sen.j: 底筒之男神・中筒之男神・上筒之男神は墨江（住吉大社）の三柱の大神（住吉三神）である。
sen.e: Soko Zutsu no O no Kami (底筒之男神), Naka Zutsu no O no Kami (中筒之男神) and Uwa Zutsu no O no Kami (上筒之男神) are the three great deities of the Sumiyoshi Shrine (Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine) in Suminoe (Sumiyoshi Sanjin (Sumiyoshi three deities)).

Sokotsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation at the bottom), Nakatsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation in the middle) and Uwatsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation in the upper) are the three great gods of Sumie (Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine) (Sumiyoshi Sanjin [Sumiyoshi three gods]).

Sokotsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation at the bottom), Nakatsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation in the middle) and Uwatsutsu no O no Kami (the god of navigation in the upper) are the three great gods of Sumie (Sumiyoshi-taisha Shrine) (Sumiyoshi Sanjin [Sumiyoshi three gods]).

sen.j: 祓戸大神も参照のこと。
sen.e: See also Haraedo-no-okami.
See also the article of Haraedo no okami.
See also the article of Haraedo no okami.

sen.j: 次に左の目を洗うと天照大神（あまてらすおほみかみ）が生まれた。
sen.e: Next, he washed his left eye and Amaterasu Omikami came into being.
Next, Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) was born by his washing his left eye.
Next, Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) was born by his washing his left eye.

sen.j: 右の目を洗うとツクヨミ（つくよみのみこと）が生まれた。
sen.e: He washed his right eye and Tsukuyomi (Tsukuyomi no Mikoto) came into being.
Tsukuyomi (Tsukuyomi no Mikoto, literally "Moon Reader") was born by his washing his right eye.
Tsukuyomi (Tsukuyomi no Mikoto, literally "Moon Reader") was born by his washing his right eye.

sen.j: 鼻を洗うとスサノオ（たけはやすさのをのみこと）が生まれた。
sen.e: He washed his nose and Susano (Takehaya Susano no Mikoto) came into being.
Susano (Takehaya Susano no Mikoto) was born by his washing his nose.
Susano (Takehaya Susano no Mikoto) was born by his washing his nose.

sen.j: イザナギは、最後に三貴子を得たと喜び、天照大御神に首飾りの玉の緒を渡して高天原を委任した。
sen.e: Izanagi was delighted that he got three noble children in the end, and handed a necklace made from a string of beads to Amaterasu Oomikami and entrusted Takamanohara (the plain of high heaven) to her.
Izanagi was delighted that he got Mihashira no uzuno miko at last, and handed a necklace of beads to Amaterasu Omikami and entrusted Takamanohara (the plain of high heaven) to her.
Izanagi was delighted that he got Mihashira no uzuno miko at last, and handed a necklace of beads to Amaterasu Omikami and entrusted Takamanohara (the plain of high heaven) to her.

sen.j: その首飾りの玉の名を、御倉板挙之神（みくらたなのかみ）と言う。
sen.e: The necklace of beads is called Mikura Tana no Kami (御倉板挙之神).
sen.cmt: 原文「首飾りの玉の名」とありますが、調べたところこの名前は首飾りそのものの名前であり、首飾りを構成する玉の名ではないようでした。
sen.e: The necklace of beads is called Mikura Tana no Kami.
The necklace of beads is called Mikura Tana no Kami.

sen.j: 月読命には夜の食国（をすくに）を、建速須佐之男命には海原を委任した。
sen.e: Then he entrusted Tsukuyomi no Mikoto with the Yoru no Osukuni (夜の食国, the realm of the night), and Takehaya Susano no Mikoto with the ocean.
Then he entrusted Tsukuyomi no Mikoto with the Yoru no Osukuni (the realm of the night) and Takehaya Susano no Mikoto with the ocean.
Then he entrusted Tsukuyomi no Mikoto with the Yoru no Osukuni (the realm of the night) and Takehaya Susano no Mikoto with the ocean.

sen.j: イザナギ・イザナミは大八洲国を産み終えたあと、さまざまな神々を生んでいった。
sen.e: Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to numerous deities after they finished giving birth to the Oyashima-guni (Eight Great Islands).
Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to numerous gods after they finished giving birth to the Oyashima no kuni.
Izanagi and Izanami gave birth to numerous gods after they finished giving birth to the Oyashima no kuni.
